Entering year 4 of sharing my portfolio publicly, I start each year by laying out my top 10 positions. 

Positioning will evolve over the year as the theses develop, with performance (98% CAGR) and transactions independently verified by a third party. 

savvytrader.com/StockSavvySh‚Ä¶

MY TOP 10 GROWTH PORTFOLIO POSITIONS ENTERING 2026

1. $RKLB building the future of space logistics
2. $CLPT providing a navigation platform for neurosurgeons
3. $JMIA scaling e-commerce & logistics across Africa
4. $EOSE building zinc storage built for nonstop compute
5. $ASTS building the communications layer that monetizes space-based connectivity
6. $TMDX expanding organ care through a growth fleet & network effect
7. $VKTX developing oral & injectable GLP-1s for obesity & diabetes
8. $SOFI becoming a full-stack digital bank positioned for a liquidity upcycle
9. $IONQ positioning quantum as the overflow layer once classical compute hits physical limit
10. $IREN  building compute at industrial scale

15 NAMES THAT COULD BOUNCE BACK IN 2026

1. $PYPL | PayPal (~81% drawdown)
2. $BMNR | Bitmine (~77% drawdown)
3. $FISV | Fiserv (~72% drawdown)
4. $VG | Venture Global (~71% drawdown)

AI DATA CENTERS WILL QUADRUPLE GLOBAL POWER DEMAND IN THE NEXT 10 YEARS

Battery storage led by $TSLA & $EOSE will stabilize the grid by storing excess generation and discharging during peak inference cycles.

Nuclear will anchor the baseload with $OKLO, $SMR, $BWXT & $CEG delivering nonstop clean power straight to AI campuses while upstream fuel supply from $CCJ, $UUUU & $LEU secures the inputs that make long-duration nuclear viable.

Transmission, turbines & cooling will close the loop with $VST, $GEV & $VRT expanding the grid and infrastructure that move the energy behind AI‚Äôs next decade.

Natural gas will keep the grid stable between renewable cycles with $VG & $NEXT expanding LNG capacity to guarantee uninterrupted power for AI loads.

Renewables like $FSLR, $BE & $NEE will drive the marginal cost of compute lower by supplying cheap daytime energy that feeds grid-scale storage.
$AMD revenue is expected to grow from ~$32B in 2025 to ~$84B by 2028

$MU is ripping to start 2026 because memory is the real AI bottleneck in 2026.

Data centers, edge devices & autonomy all need far more memory than the market is pricing.

The next two years are where $EOSE actually shows up in the numbers.

AI data centers create brutal load swings and long-duration zinc storage is built for that exact problem.
